page.title: 02Local History
page.content: The land between the Wolds and the Marsh is flat and clayey.{ABY & {CLAYTHORPE.}The churchyard at Aby is still used but Aby & Claythorpe churches were demolished centuries ago.{GREENFIELD.}Of the site of the Priory at Greenfield, built about 1150 and occupied by Cistercian nuns, only the moat remains. There is a barrow to the southwest of this.{WOODTHORPE.}The hall now has about 120 caravans on 15 acres of land, also a swimming pool, golf club, bowling green and garden centre. One oak tree is over{1060 years old.{TOTHILL.}The Manor and the church, built on the site of an older church, have been demolished. Near a round hill,{"Toot-hill"}is a 20ft wide ditch, and ancient military earthwork. A branch of the LNER closed in 1970. The station houses at Claythorpe and Authorpe are now good dwellings.
